name: Murderlize all Humans! - Vic20 +16k
description:
Title: Murderlize All Humans
Platform: Commodore VIC-20 +16kb memory expansion
Media: Floppy disk / Tape
Video: PAL/NTSC
Interface: Joystick
Software type: Arcade
Written by: W E de Villiers

Berserk! the video arcade game was released in 1980 by Stern Electronics. It was one of the first arcade games to feature synthesized speech. This was at a time when memory costs were at a premium. 'Murdelize all humans' uses Berserk! as inspiration but does not attempt to copy it.

Joystick left/right/up/down with the fire button to discharge the plasma gun. Fire at levers to alter their state (The unlock symbol at the bottom right will light up on achieving the correct combination). Just run over the exit key to pick it up. As for the Lovebot - avoidance means life.

 Greetings
Huffelduff (User handle on the VIC-20 Denial forum)
